page.title: 07Agriculture-Biddestone
page.content: The farmland covers about 2,300 acres divided 1/3 grassland and 2/3 arable. The grassland supports 200 dairy cows plus the young replacemnt cattle and a smaller number of beef cattle. With the addition of cereal concentrates the milk production is around 250,000 gallons annually. The arable land is cropped with wheat, barley and a small acreage of oilseed rape and peas.The corn output is around 1000 tons of wheat and 2,500 tons of barley. There are five farms based in the parish with land from others running across the boundary. The land is mainly worked by the people who own it and very few hired men. With the use of modern techniques and high inputs of fuel,fertilizers and chemicals the farmland is producing more than at any other time in history
